name: Lowland Hinter
role_in_state: Food and material feeder to coastal ports
economy_niches: harvesting of reed & bog-plants for boat/ritual reagents
seasonal labor pool for shipyards and preserves
inland transshipment & cartage to river ports
culture_adjustments: strong kin/clan land tenure alongside oral genealogies
dialectal drift toward Riveric speech; less Coastal Tongues purity
lower guild penetration; more customary village courts
seasonal migration to ports creates mixed coastal-hinter identities
constraints: poor deepwater access limits direct ship trade
coastal guilds control high-value processing and re-export
ritual magic reliant on scarce imported reagents
notes: strategic as grain reserve and reed harvest zone
regular seasonal labor flows to coastal shipyards and salting houses
local sacred groves protect key reagent plants; customary protections affect harvest timing
